Rico Sta. Cruz.message:
Merge pull request #201 from dminkovsky/patch-1

Use injected jQuery in closure
Use the umdjs loader for better npm compatibility.

Merge pull request #103 from wambotron/ie10-transitionend-fix

Updating 'transitionEnd' to 'transitionend' for IE10 support

Merge pull request #161 from emagnier/master

Add a missing easing: 'easeInCubic'

Merge pull request #165 from Bonga/patch-1

Remove redundant line

Merge pull request #114 from FWeinb/master

Add 'filter' prefixer (@FWeinb, #114)

Merge pull request #41 from philipwalton/repaint

Use `offsetWidth` to repaint. (@philipwalton, #41)
Eh, rewrite the $.support propagation to be less destructive. #67
Don't override jQuery.support for properties that have already been set. Fixes Bootstrap. (#67)

Merge pull request #44 from matthewlein/master

Penner equations added
In jQuery 1.8+, let jQuery handle the prefixing of transformOrigin and transition.
Remove 'use strict', since we're using document/navigator/window inside the entire plugin.
Fix JSHint warning about hasOwnProperty (though actually it's always been okay).
Stop rotateX/rotateY/etc from happening in non-Webkits. Closes #15.
Use timers by default instead of transitionEnd.
Allow disabling using the transitionEnd property.
Fix IE8 error about .indexOf. Closes #12 and #8.
Only check for Chrome-ness once. Related to #11.
Clean up transitions properly. Related to #14.
Fix a bug where the default duration and easing can sometimes not be used.
Only animate what is needed (ie, don't use 'transition-property: all').
Queue properly even if duration is 0.
Make it more robust when it's disabled.
Standardize property names; fix a potential memory leak in IE.
Use MSTransition for IE10 as per the IE developer guide.
Fix Opera issue with chained transitions. Closes #1.
Support the hypothetical future browser that supports transitions without vendor properties.
Don't set transition property if duration is 0.
Immediately fire callbacks when transitions isn't supported.
Small refactor to trim down filesize.
Stop using dashes when accessing styles.

David Langer.message: fix modification of original property object

Dmitry Minkovsky.message:
Use injected jQuery in closure

Right? Why not?

Yousef.message: added scaleX and scaleY css hooks
bugfix wrong scope when callOrQueue doesn't queue

fixed bug where queue would always be set to true

fixed bug where queue would always be set to true when using `.transition(properties, options)

Ebrahim Abuelnga.message:
Remove redundant line

Remove an extra line that tests if property already exists and needs no prefix.

Mike Low.message: added a more reliable fix to toMS()
Fixed issues breaking duration property - changed toMS to check for Nan, and deep cloned properties before deleting.

Rafal Lindemann.message: Support for transition(properties, options) syntax. fixes #25

Fabrice Weinberg.message: Add transition support for css filter

Datrio.message:
fixes #76 - compatibility issue with jQuery 1.8

Fixing the problem with "Uncaught TypeError: Object none has no method 'setFromString'"

unknown.message: Added query for presence of 'next' in the transition procedure

Lay Flags.message: Fix scope of callback. Fixes issue #37

Philip Walton.message: updated the deferredRun function to force a repaint without using setTimeout

Sasha Koss.message: Fix bug with undefined next function (can be raised by 374 line by calling `fn();`)

Pepe Cano.message: fixed: queue property did not work as expected, queue could never be avoided

Robert Reinhard.message:
Fixing scales in Chrome

We've seen the 3D version of Scale() not work in Chrome when the
element being scaled extends outside of the viewport.  Thus, we're
forcing Chrome to not use the 3d transforms as well.  Not sure if
translate is affected, but not risking it.

Curtis Steckel.message: Fix to z-layer scaling to 0 with scale3d(x,y,z)
